description.narrative: 1. Support of SMEs: Target investees will be SMEs, which are a very capital constrained sector and limited access to bank debt or capital markets for financing their growth strategies 2. Job creation: Investments in SMEs in the growth phase leads to substantial job creation, at a greater rate thn the national average 3. Private sector development: Addition of value to portfolio companies through capacity building, improved corporate governance and transparency, while providing operational and financial expertise, support in evaluating new business opportunities and building business partnerships 4. Incorporating IFC's E&S standards, thereby contributing to sustainable economic development

The proposed project is an investment in India 2020 Fund II (I2F-II or the Fund), a fund which aims to offer growth equity and strategic and operational assistance to Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in India. I2F-II aims to invest USD 5-15 million per investment for a significant minority stake. The investment focus will be on high growth businesses with a track record of product and process innovation and which are well positioned to bring about transformation in their respective sectors/ industry. The Fund aims to invest in sectors which benefit from and promote consumer demand and purchasing power. These sectors may include, but are not limited to, healthcare and education, as well as rural consumption and agribusiness. The Fund is a successor to India 2020 Fund I a 2008 vintage fund of $100mm with an estimated exit Gross IRR of 30% with strong development effects on job creation, gender equality and corporate governance.
